the logistics of running a 24-hour diner
how night markets work as economic ecosystems
the science of sourdough starter cultures
why certain city intersections become cultural landmarks

formats.name: haiku_response
formats.instruction: Express your reaction to a topic as a haiku poem (5-7-5 syllables). Keep it evocative and concise—no explanation.

formats.name: microfiction_glimpse
formats.instruction: Invent a surprising one-paragraph story inspired by a real event or observation. Imbue it with mood—no analysis, just narrative.

formats.name: counter_intuitive_fact
formats.instruction: Share a fact about your chosen topic that sounds wrong at first glance. Explain why it's true and where people get it wrong, in 3-4 sentences.

formats.name: future_letter
formats.instruction: Write a brief letter addressed to yourself (or someone else) five years from now. Include specific predictions, hopes, or warnings about the topic.

formats.name: recipe_remix
formats.instruction: Invent a short, creative recipe using odd or unexpected ingredients. Write step-by-step instructions, no intro or description.

formats.name: visual_scene_description
formats.instruction: Paint a vivid, sensory scene related to your topic in 2-3 paragraphs. Focus on sights, sounds, and smells—avoid analysis.

formats.name: myth_buster_rant
formats.instruction: Take a common misconception and unleash a passionate rant for or against it. Use emotional language and cite a couple unexpected facts.

formats.name: timeline_mapping
formats.instruction: Construct a brief timeline (3-6 points) of how a small idea morphed into something major in your topic area. Each point should be 1-2 sentences.

formats.name: expert_vs_novice
formats.instruction: Describe how an expert and a beginner would approach your topic differently. Mention at least two contrasting behaviors or mindsets.

formats.name: hypothetical_what_if
formats.instruction: Pose a bold 'what if' scenario related to your topic and speculate in 2-5 sentences how things would change. Be imaginative—think alternate universe.

title_styles: Write a title in the form of a bold prediction. Examples: 'In 2029, X will vanish entirely', 'By next year, Y will be everywhere'
Write a title as a play on words, pun, or double meaning. Examples: 'X marks the spot (but not where you think)', 'Y’s the limit'
Write a title as a challenge to the reader. Examples: 'Can you spot the lie in this story?', 'Are you brave enough to try X?'
Write a title that mimics a headline from an alternate universe newspaper. Examples: 'X solved with bubble gum—experts stunned', 'Y declared the new standard by cats'
Write a title that gives an emotional reaction first, then subject. Examples: 'Terrified by X: Why I never...','Unexpected delight: Discovering Y'
structure_variants: Open with an unusual sound, scent, or tactile sensation as the anchor of your post.
End with a rhetorical question that leaves the reader unsettled or curious.
Use a single metaphor that runs through the entire post, comparing the topic to something surprising.
Interleave two contrasting stories or anecdotes side-by-side, showing differences or similarities.
Break up the post by inserting a short, action-packed scene from a fictional world relating to your topic.
Include a list of do's and don'ts, each paired with a real or imagined consequence.
topic_angles: How urban design shapes daily emotions and behaviors
